--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Dewboy, could you sent me to my mail your idea for a faction or 
> could you please repost it in NBW's forums?, I guess that due all 
> those virus in web we haven't received yet it.

It's on the message board, which apparently hasn't been posted on 
otherwise since I've left (are you all just too lazy to come to the 
site and log in?).  Anyway, here it is:

With my school year drawing to a close, I'm considering coming back 
for the summer. I have a suggestion though for a new faction (please 
note, this will for a while at least be a one man faction). I need 
council approval though, and to know how much they can do. Here it 
is: 

All these being have some ability to predict the future, they 
increase this by stealing the "hero/villan potential" from various 
subjects who had the potential to be heros/villans (also killing the 
subjects, but you have to immobilize them for a few minutes). 

Their leader is named Seer. He supposedly cannot die, but he never 
come to earth so he's a none factor. All his minions are required to 
give some of their stolen hero/villan potential to him, and he has 
incredible power, he also gives each of his servants a prophesy 
telling some detail of their deaths to help delay it. 

The reason they send their minions to earth (only one at a time, 
which is why it's one man, they don't want to do to much damage), is 
because over millions of years the change caused by someone with 
even a small bit of hero/villan potential is incredible, so the 
potential they can steal is almost limitless. They give their 
servants a target before sending them back. 

I haven't thought out all the details, but the first minion would be 
named Fortuneteller (a female), and her prophesy would be: 

So long as you pay the Seer's price, no Transmetal will take your 
life (so long as you give Seer his fair share of the potential you 
steal no transmetal will kill you). 

He also has a council of three other powerful members of his 
faction, who will die, but share a prophecy of their death: 

One will die by fire, one by ice, and the last must perish thrice 
(essentially one will die, but his/her spark will return to Seer for 
a new body, after which one will die by fire, then the first will 
die again, but the same thing will happen, then one will die by ice, 
then the first will die and stay dead, but they don't know which is 
which and won't chance it putting themselves in danger). 

So I want to know how much prescience I'm allowed? How can that 
effect the game? And is it o.k. to dictate how my characters can die 
(they can still have the crap beaten out of them, but they can't be 
destroyed any other way).


> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...>
